name: This flow Runs on the IoT Sandbox
This is the message playground, let's play!
Use Debug nodes to see what kind of data come out of the LinkOuts (the INPUTS)
Then (optionally)modify those messages and pass them along to the named LinkIn nodes (the OUTPUTS)
Also, you can add your own flow and copy any input and output nodes from below into it, and they will work!
Find the devices in the rooms, using the ID number written on it that matches the first part of the input/output names below
eg the device named "motionE8DA" has all the inputs and outputs that start with /motionE8DA
split messsage
This flow Runs on the IoT Sandbox
info: This Flow translates Microbits Radio messages to/from OSC

name: Get MicroBit messages over serial from a dedicated Microbits device attached to this computer
Send UDP messages over Serial to a dedicated Microbits device attached to this computer
Then send them over UDP to the OSC Switchboard with a common naming convention
Route the messages with the OSC Switchboard!

This Flow maps OSC messages to named linkOuts and LinkIns, usually of the same name, or could be simplified.
this is so the Messages Swithboard looks clean and easy to play with
OSC Messages come in here, over port 7777
Look in the debug window to see what kind of messages are coming in
add INCOMING ROUTES based on the OSC topics
bottom output if it doesn't; pass to the next SWITCH
bottom output if it doesn't; pass to the next SWITCH, and so on...
Pass on to named LinkOut node, to match a LinkIn in the Message Switchboard
This Flow sends messages to BLE via EspruinoHub, running on another machine
info: This machine needs to have EspruinoHub installed.

name: name a link in with an OSC style address, so we can use simplenames in the OSC switchboard

set EspruinoHub server IP:Port on this node
